item.title: JUSTICE DEPARTMENT, EPA AND THE NAVAJO NATION ANNOUNCE SETTLEMENT FOR CLEANUP OF 94 ABANDONED URANIUM MINES ON THE NAVAJO NATION
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO– The United States and the Navajo Nation have entered into a settlement agreement with two affiliated subsidiaries of Freeport-McMoRan, Inc., for the cleanup of 94 abandoned uranium mines on the Navajo Nation.
item.dc:creator: Region 09

item.title: EPA orders Navajo Tribal Utility Authority to Stop Sewage Spill, Notify Public

item.title: Pueblo of Laguna Granted Federal Authority to Protect Water Quality
item.description: DALLAS – (Dec. 21, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is granting the Pueblo of Laguna N.M. authority to administer its own water quality standards and certification programs under the Clean Water Act.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Highlights Environmental Justice Innovation at Valle de Oro National Wildlife Refuge in Albuquerque, N.M.
item.description: DALLAS – (Nov. 18, 2016) Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recognized several groups for their innovative work in environmental justice (EJ) at the Valle de Oro National Wildlife Refuge.
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA Highlights Environmental Justice Innovation at Valle de Oro National Wildlife Refuge
item.description: DALLAS – (Nov. 16, 2016) This Friday, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) will recognize Friends of the Valle de Oro National Wildlife Refuge and Los Jardines Institute for their innovative work in environmental justice (EJ).
item.dc:creator: Region 06

item.title: EPA grant will aid Eight Northern Indian Pueblo Council’s pesticide outreach
item.description: DALLAS – (Oct. 31, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recently awarded the Eight Northern Indian Pueblo Council $46,887 to support pesticide programs. The council provides technical assistance on environmental issues to tribes and pueblos in New Mexico.
item.dc:creator: Region 06
